orgCommentsInfo: Comments allow administrators to leave context about communications with publishers etc.
orgMachineTagsInfo: Machine tags are intended for applications to store information about an entity. A machine tag is essentially a name/value pair, that is categorised in a namespace. The 3 parts may be used as the application sees fit.
supportedFormats: Only use of plain text is supported - no XML, JSON etc
editFormInstructions: Multi value fields position, email, phone, homepage and address are indicated by * and use the semicolon as the delimiter.
primaryCheckboxTip: Indicates that the contact is the primary contact for the given type

extra.commentContent: Commentary should be written with consideration, using language suitable for any public forum and not containing sensitive details. {break}{bold}.
extra.identifier: The value for the identifier (e.g. doi://12.123/123).
extra.identifierType: Select the type of the identifier.
extra.mtNamespace: The namespace is a category for the name/value pair tag. It may be used to distinguish groupings (e.g. crawling, processing) or to declare a true term namespace (e.g. dwc)
extra.mtName: The name for the tag (e.g. basisOfRecord, type).
extra.mtValue: The value for the tag (e.g. Living specimen, MANIS).
extra.tagValue: The value for the tag (e.g. Arthropod pitfall trap).
extra.orgTitle: Enter an accurate organization title as it is used in many key places.

name: Name
orgOverviewInfo: This information appears on the organization profile, organization pages, search results, and beyond.
